snippet.title: Niccoco takes out Palmerston Sprint
snippet.content: THE Garry Lefoe Jnr trained Niccoco took out the $135,000 bet365 Palmerston Sprint (1200m) at Fannie Bay on Saturday afternoon. The five-year-old gelding, with last year's Darwin Cup winning jockey Raymond Vigar in the saddle, swooped down the outside to win the feature race on Day 7 of the Darwin Cup Carnival. For Lefoe Jnr, it was the biggest win of his career after securing his trainer's licence 12 months ago once settling in Darwin from Alice Springs. An emergency for the biggest sprint race in the Northern Territory when the field was finalised, Niccoco got a start following the scratching of Your Excellency during the week. Niccoco ($6.50) cut down the gallant Captain Punch (Richie Oakford) in the home straight to take out the race by a length. Captain Punch ($7.50) from the Gary Clarke stable looked to have pinched a winning lead turning for home before Niccoco stormed home. The David Bates' trained He's Our Woody (Kayla Cross), the $3.70 favourite, gave Captain Punch too much start before finishing strongly to grab a narrow third. The highly successful Cup Carnival concludes on Monday - Day 8 - with the running of the $200,000 Carlton Mid Darwin Cup (2000m).
